meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he swore he would finish his homework.
meanings.sent2: She swore to always tell the truth.
meanings.sent3: The cat swore it would catch the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The wind swore to blow away all the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The old tree swore to stand tall through every storm.

meanings.definition: to make a solemn declaration or affirmation by a specified deity or object
meanings.sent1: In court, he swore to tell the whole truth.
meanings.sent2: She swore on her mother's grave that she didn't take the money.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel swore by the acorn that it was the best nut.
meanings.sent4: The river swore by the moon to carry its reflection with pride.
meanings.sent5: The mountain swore by the sun to remain majestic for eternity.

meanings.definition: to use profane oaths or language
meanings.sent1: He swore loudly when he stubbed his toe.
meanings.sent2: She swore in frustration when her computer crashed.
meanings.sent3: The parrot swore in a funny voice that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm swore with lightning and booming sounds.
meanings.sent5: The angry sea swore with crashing waves against the shore.
